junk_data.name: Broken Blender
junk_data.desc: An old, weathered blender made of plastics and trace metals. Electronic guts spew through its broken base.

junk_data.name: Rusted Washing Machine
junk_data.desc: A thrown out washing machine. There’s plenty of crude metal to salvage, if you can carry it.

junk_data.name: Busted Flashlight
junk_data.desc: A heavy-duty flashlight, the bulb hanging on by a scrap. Not particularly worth much.

junk_data.name: Laptop
junk_data.desc: A long forgotten laptop, subjected to the elements. As valuable as they are rare.

junk_data.name: Copper Wiring
junk_data.desc: Discarded, copper wiring. They appear to have been cut and shredded before being discarded.

junk_data.name: Metal Pipe
junk_data.desc: A thick, metal pipe. Quite heavy, but a good piece of scrap.

junk_data.name: Broken Fan
junk_data.desc: A discarded fan, surprisingly intact. Some of its internals could prove valuable.

junk_data.name: TV
junk_data.desc: The broken shell of a tv. Heavy and cumbersome, but could hold valuable scrap.

junk_data.name: Toilet
junk_data.desc: A broken toilet. Is heavy, but contains plenty of ceramic.

junk_data.name: Cell Phone
junk_data.desc: A broken cell phone. Trace amounts of rare metals are within.

junk_data.name: Car Battery
junk_data.desc: The discarded battery of a car. Could prove valuable.

junk_data.name: Spark Plug
junk_data.desc: An old spark plug. Broken, but could be fixed.

junk_data.name: Coil Spring
junk_data.desc: A portion of a car’s suspension. Still in good shape.

junk_data.name: Radiator
junk_data.desc: A thrown out car radiator. A bit heavy, but still valuable.

junk_data.name: Car Mirror
junk_data.desc: A cracked car mirror. Could still work.

junk_data.name: Car wheel
junk_data.desc: A wheel frame for a car. It could be repurposed.

junk_data.name: Alternator
junk_data.desc: A discarded alternator from a car. It still works, somehow.

junk_data.name: Blue Toothbrush
junk_data.desc: It appears to have been used by multiple rats.

junk_data.name: Klein Bottle
junk_data.desc: I’m not quite sure how to orient this thing.
